project.teaser: The greatest challenges towards the worldwide success of battery-powered electric vehicles revolve around the safety, energy density, and cost of the battery technologies. Solid-state polymer electrolytes and lithium metal anode address these challenges by replacing the...
project.objective: The greatest challenges towards the worldwide success of battery-powered electric vehicles revolve around the safety, energy density, and cost of the battery technologies. Solid-state polymer electrolytes and lithium metal anode address these challenges by replacing the flammable and unstable liquid electrolytes and enabling dendrite-free cycling of high-energy lithium metal cells manufactured by sustainable and cost-effective processing. The PSIONIC project advances the development of all-solid-state battery technology by employing amorphous cross-linked Polyethylene oxide (PEO) laminated on the thin lithium foil at the anode and high voltage cathode coated with a single-ion conductive polymer. This will allow to replace the flammable and unstable liquid electrolytes and enabling dendrite-free cycling of high-energy lithium metal cells manufactured by sustainable processing. Special attention will be devoted to the optimization of interfaces between the active material and polymer electrolyte. Materials selection will enable the use of the manufacturing technology available at BlueSolutions, which is readily scalable, based on sustainable processing using solvent-free extrusion. PSIONIC is aiming to develop cells with a safety hazard level 2, since no liquid component will be in the cell at the end of the project. The research and innovation actions carried under the PSIONIC project will not only just contribute to the technological advancements of all-solid-state Li-ion batteries in terms of safety, reliability, performance, cost, and sustainability, but will also enable higher uptake by the electromobility sector and end consumers, paving a pathway towards climate neutrality, and green energy transition.
project.title: High voltage, room temperature single-ion polymer electrolyte for safer all solid state lithium metal batteries
project.keywords: Single-ion conductive polymer, All-solid-state battery, Sustainable processing

article.title: Improving all-solid-state batteries for electric vehicles

result.title: D7.3 First year risk management plan
result.description: BS will prepare the risk management report for the first year of the projectThe goal of this document is to allow the Project Management Team to accurately and timely try to avoid unwanted risks and as necessary take action in mitigating or applying corrective measures to control potential negative effects to the project This report is the outcome of the Task72

result.title: A New (Trifluoromethane)Sulfonylimide Single-Ion Conductor with PEG Spacer for All-Solid-State Lithium-Based Batteries

details.authors: Gabriele Lingua, Vladislav Y. Shevtsov, Petr S. Vlasov, Laura Puchot, Claudio Gerbaldi, Alexander S. Shaplov

result.title: D7.2 Data management plan prepared and maintained
result.description: To improve and maximise access to and reuse data generated by the PSIONIC project BS will elaborate a detailed Data Management Plan DMP The DMP will outline how the different project data will be collected and how these will be handled during and after the project focusing on the data collection methodology and data sharing issuesThe revised version towards the end of the project will be deliveredThis report is the outcome of the Task73

result.title: D6.2 First Communication, Dissemination and Exploitation Plan
result.description: This first master plan describes the action plan regarding dissemination and exploitation of PSIONIC results innovations and concepts together with progress on communications activities The document includes all the information needed to facilitate the communication efforts of the PSIONIC project partners The mapping of stakeholders at European national and local levels list of relevant events timing of communication and dissemination activities media channels etc are detailedThe plan along with the strategy is largely based on what is described in the proposal and GA but with some refinements arising from business model work It is based on use of an IPR registry and a clear distinction between dissemination exploitation and communication A list of the projects KERs Key Exploitable Results is providedThis document is the outcome of Task 61 and Task 62

result.title: D6.1 Report on project identity and website
result.description: The report covers the development of the project brand and visual identity In order to make the project visible and increase its impacts the consortium creates PSIONIC identity and develops the associated communication tools video website social media accounts etc This document is the outcome of Task 61

result.title: Protective Coating for Stable Cycling of Li-Metal Batteries Based on Cellulose and Single-Ion Conducting Polymer

details.authors: Mariana Vargas Ordaz, Nejc Pavlin, Matteo Gastaldi, Claudio Gerbaldi, Robert Dominko

result.title: D7.1 Project method and activity plan
result.description: This document represents the project management handbook that contains all related information for running the PSIONIC project By giving an overview of the objectives activities owners in the main part the handbook summarises all regulations and guidelines regarding PSIONIC project management structures and procedures aggregating some useful information from the Grant Agreement and its annexes and the Consortium Agreement where relevantThis report is the outcome of the Task71

result.title: D6.4 Mid-term Communication and Dissemination Plan
result.description: The second document contains amendments to the first PSIONIC DisseminationPlan, which aims to describe the measures proposed by the PSIONIC consortium to disseminate the mid term project results and communicate on its activities. These actions take into consideration a variety of communication channels and target groups and presents a draft plan for how partners would enable promote project activities and results.This document is the outcome of the Task 6.1.

result.title: Formulating PEO-polycarbonate blends as solid polymer electrolytes by solvent-free extrusion

details.authors: Francesco Gambino, Matteo Gastaldi, Alia Jouhara, Samuel Malburet, Simone Galliano, Nicola Cavallini, Giovanna Colucci, Marco Zanetti, Alberto Fina, Giuseppe Antonio Elia, Claudio Gerbaldi

result.title: Periodic Reporting for period 1 - PSIONIC (High voltage, room temperature single-ion polymer electrolyte for safer all solid state lithium metal batteries)
result.teaser: The EU’s ambitious target of achieving climate neutrality by 2050 urges the need to reduce greenhouse gas (GHG) emissions, particularly from the transportation sector. However, the green and clean transformation of the transport sector cannot be facilitated without...

category.title: Report Summary
category.description: Result: Publishable summary (FP7 SESAM) and Summary for publication (H2020 SyGMa)

category.title: Digital agenda
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development of digital technologies and the digitisation of the economy and society (known as ‘Digital transition’).

category.title: Clean air
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the clean air policy (National Emission Ceiling Directive) aiming to improve ambient air quality and tackle air pollution, to protect the environment and human health.

category.title: Artificial intelligence
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development and deployment of AI-based technologies and solutions. Projects that develop AI-tools as part of their research method are included

category.title: Climate action
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to both mitigating climate change (e.g., contributions to the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions) and adapting to climate change by building resilience (e.g., regarding floods, droughts, spatial planning and better governance, adaptation to changing climate in value chains, etc.).

category.title: Biodiversity
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to Europe’s biodiversity’s path to recovery including species protection, ecosystem conservation, and habitat rehabilitation, all essential for resilience in climate adaptation and addressing ecosystem services but also environmental crime and the health-environment connection.
